API Reference¶

Iris classification utility using scikit-learn.

This module provides a small helper, classify_iris(), that trains a DecisionTreeClassifier and returns the accuracy on a provided test set.

It also exposes a simple CLI when executed as a script to quickly verify the model performance on the built-in Iris dataset.

iris.classify_iris(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test)¶

Train a DecisionTreeClassifier on Iris data and evaluate accuracy.

Parameters:

  • X_train – 2D array-like of shape (n_train_samples, n_features) Training features.

  • X_test – 2D array-like of shape (n_test_samples, n_features) Test features.

  • y_train – 1D array-like of shape (n_train_samples,) Training labels.

  • y_test – 1D array-like of shape (n_test_samples,) Test labels.

Returns:

Classification accuracy on the test set, in the range [0.0, 1.0].

Return type:

float

Examples

>>> from sklearn.datasets import load_iris
>>> from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
>>> data = load_iris()
>>> X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(
...     data.data, data.target, test_size=0.2, random_state=42
... )
>>> round(classify_iris(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test), 3) >= 0.8
True
